item.title: Aid groups in Gaza and West Bank thrown lifeline as Israel court pauses ban threat
item.summary: Dozens of well-known groups faced shutdown under a new Israeli law, although the reprieve might be temporary.

item.title: 'They seized everything': Yemen's Houthi rebels drive aid groups to the brink
item.summary: Aid groups - a lifeline for millions of Yemenis - are being squeezed out of existence in areas under the control of the rebels, the BBC hears.

item.title: Epstein tried to buy a palace in Morocco days before his arrest in 2019
item.summary: The disgraced financier was in talks to buy luxury abode Bin Ennakhi - but the purchase was never completed.

item.title: Israeli soldiers shot a Palestinian boy and stood around as he bled to death, video shows
item.summary: Israeli forces blocked Palestinian ambulances while a 14-year-old lay bleeding for at least 45 minutes.

item.title: 'People are getting poorer': How Iran's struggling economy is changing how families live
item.summary: The soaring cost of living has left people struggling to afford basic items - creating pressures which led to mass protests.

item.title: US embassy to provide passport services at West Bank settlements
item.summary: Israel's government welcomes the US decision, but the Palestinian Authority says it is a clear violation of international law.

item.title: Trump hits out at reports that top US general warned against attacking Iran
item.summary: General Dan Caine has warned that strikes against Iran could be risky, potentially drawing the US into a prolonged conflict, US media report.

item.title: Lawyers appeal to UN over men jailed in alleged power struggle in UAE
item.summary: The son of one tells the BBC how 11 years spent in prison has taken a toll on his father's health.

item.title: Anti-government student protests spread to more Iranian universities
item.summary: A fresh wave of anti-government protests at several Iranian universities that began on Saturday has spread to more campuses.

item.title: Iranian national jailed in France for promoting terrorism online
item.summary: Tehran has indicated Mahdieh Esfandiari could be exchanged for two French nationals it convicted of espionage.
